link.synopsis: A married woman is unable to resist a fling with a younger man in this dark comedy. link.synopsis: When Erik (Jonas Rimeika), a Stockholm urbanite, learns that his beauty-queen sister, Susie (Tuva Novotny), is missing, he returns to their rural hometown to find her. Award-winning director Ulf Malmros helms this black comedy doused with hipster flair.

link.synopsis: Considered the first great comedic film actor, Charlie Chaplin was also a gifted director, writer and composer who achieved international celebrity. This video includes a documentary of Chaplin's life; three of Chaplin's greatest shorts, The Rink (1916), The Immigrant (1917) and The Vagabond (1916); and his first feature film, the Keystone comedy Tillie's Punctured Romance (1914), which catapulted Chaplin and co-star Marie Dressler to stardom.

link.synopsis: Legendary slapstick comedian Harold Lloyd made audiences roar as a bespectacled everyman who managed to wriggle himself out of many a perilous situation, all the while trying to get the girl. Lloyd's fearless acrobatic skills and agility put him on par with Buster Keaton and Charlie Chaplin. Watch a true master of physical comedy in this collection of 10 Lloyd silent films (many co-starring his wife, Mildred Davis) from the Hal Roach Studios.

link.synopsis: Sit-ups are good for the waistline, but laughing is more fun -- and this evening of no-holds-barred comedy (from the producers of Jive Chicken and Parking Lot Pimpin') is bound to make your abs sore. You'll be begging for mercy as the freshest voices from the Los Angeles underground -- including Madd Marv, Lester Berry, Bubba Loc, D'Militante and Derek Ellis -- deliver hilarious musings on pop culture, politics and (of course) your mama.

link.synopsis: A hired killer pairs up with an amateur filmmaker to provide clients with satisfying footage of enemies getting whacked in this black comedy. Business is down, so hit man Bart (Eric Kot) is thrilled when Mrs. Ma (Miao Felin) hires him to kill her enemies -- and film the murders. But Bart's first video killing stinks, so he hires filmmaker Chuen (Cheung Tat-Ming). Although business subsequently picks up, their notoriety creates complications. …

link.synopsis: Legendary slapstick comedy team Abbott and Costello meet Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, the Keystone cops and a mummy in this best-of collection. Boris Karloff stars as Dr. Jekyll in the 1953 feature "Abbott and Costello Meet Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde"; Max Sennett cameos as a pie-thrower 1955's "Abbott and Costello Meet the Keystone Kops" (which ends with a classic chase scene); and the boys are hunted by cultists and mummies in the third feature.

link.synopsis: Fate mingles with the power of suggestion in this insightful comedy. On a drunken whim, friends James (Mike McGlone), Phil (Tony Hale) and Lewis (James Urbaniak) visit a fortuneteller. As the woman gives each friend a vision of the future and hits the nail on the head, James, Phil and Lewis are shaken by what they hear. Despite their jaded outlook when it comes to fate, two of the friends instantly alter their lives in significant ways.
link.title: synopsis
Pusher 2: With Blood on My Hands
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
Andy Barker P.I.: The Complete Series
The Men Who Stare at Goats

link.synopsis: A simple phone call creates a series of misunderstandings for two lovers in Jeanne Labrune's fast-paced romantic comedy. After a friend calls to inquire about some real estate, Catherine (Sandrine Kiberlain) argues with Raphael (Jean-Pierre Darroussin), who then suffers a crisis and loses his job. Nosy neighbors, wayward bouquets and angry playwrights cause further complications, until at last the couple meet at a restaurant to sort things out.
link.title: synopsis
The Diving Bell and the Butterfly
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: After the FBI forces him to betray an East Coast mob boss, Carmine "The Beans" Pasquale (Mark DeCarlo), with his wife Gina (Jeanette Puhich) and son Vincent (Clayton Taylor) in tow, is relocated to Utah by the federal witness protection program in this laugh-out-loud comedy. As the Pasquales -- posing as the Cheeseman family from Omaha, Neb. -- settle into their new home in a morally upright Mormon community, life is anything but normal.

link.synopsis: Obsessed with bringing "The Biggest Band in the World" (that would be U2) to his native country for a private concert, Claudio Caballero (Eduardo Arroyuelo) gambles $500,000 and lets it ride. After all, given the prospect of meeting his idols, he's willing to risk everything. Writer-director Fernando Kalife must have a soft spot for Bono and The Edge, which would explain his concept for this creative Mexican comedy.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Death Beats a Dull Life

link.synopsis: This nuanced romantic comedy centers on evasive bride-to-be Katrine (Sidse Babett Knudsen), whose world turns topsy-turvy when her sister's ex-beau, Thomsen (Bjorn Kjellman), suddenly shows up on Katrine's doorstep two days before her nuptials. Ignoring their mutual attraction, they set off to put the finishing touches on her wedding, resulting in a series of madcap adventures. Meanwhile, Katrine withholds some life-altering news from Thomsen.
link.title: synopsis
Tony Palmer's Classic Film of John Osborne and the Gift of Friendship
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: In this clever post-9/11 comedy, director Jay Martel pokes fun at the hysteria of fear -- all without cracking a smile. Traveling to the small town of Junction, home of "The World's Largest Stool," doctoral candidate John Stevens hopes to authenticate the artifact for his thesis on roadside attractions. But after the recent vandalism of an important icon, town officials are on the lookout for terrorists, and John is as good a suspect as any.
link.title: synopsis
Must See Places of the World
WWE: Viva La Raza! The Legacy of Eddie Guerrero
The 2005 Academy Award Short Films Collection

link.synopsis: Break out the napkins for this deliciously different comedy that follow the antics of three couples who hold barbecues on the same day and agree to attend one another's gatherings. First up are Willie (Anthony Marquez) and Vera (Rebecca May Lane), who happen run out of beer. Then, there's Dinah (Quasi) and Stan (Kyle Ethan), whose party is preempted by Beef (Clay Colton) and Candy's (Lancaster Smith) trial run for a grilling magazine tournament.

link.synopsis: This Mexican comedy -- whose title translates into "The Last Night" -- is the final installment in a three-part series (with The First Night and The Second Night rounding out the trilogy). With the ultimate goal of dispelling myths about sex in Latin culture, the film tells the stories of 50-something Gloria (Cecilia Gabriela), a young married couple (Mariana Ávila and Ricardo Palacio) and the single-and-searching Elena (Elizabeth Valdez).

A Good Death Beats a Dull Life
Donde Quedo La Abuela? El Viaje De La Nonna

link.synopsis: Director Bill Robertson presents a clever comedy about trying to find the perfect apartment -- and the perfect life -- as well as knowing when to give up the search. Starring Andrew Tarbet and Kari Matchett, the film features a critically acclaimed soundtrack by legendary singer-songwriter Mary Margaret O'Hara, with bonus material that includes music videos of the songs "I Don't Care" and "Dream I Had."
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: An acid addict trips on one adventure after another in this offbeat comedy. The film centers on an LSD freak who can't go a day without ingesting the psychedelic drug. On a permanent drug-induced odyssey, the Acid King experiences quite a few misadventures, including being tormented by toilet sharks, trying to navigate a sidewalk engulfed in flames and meeting some beautiful maidens. Peter Steele from goth metal band Type O Negative guest stars.

link.synopsis: In his feature-film debut, writer, director and actor Matt Mitler (who later lent his voice to the "Pokemon" television series) plays Danny Gold, a struggling actor whose bizarre Lenny Bruce-style comic routine proves to be his ticket to the big time. But there's one catch: He just may go crazy before he gets there. This oddball comedy -- which includes several out-of-nowhere musical numbers -- co-stars Camryn Manheim and Debra Wilson ("Mad TV").

link.synopsis: This touching made-for-television drama profiles the true-life friendship between Peter Cook (Rhys Ifans) and Dudley Moore (Aidan McArdle), who met as undergraduates in 1960 and became international stars as half of the four-man comedy sketch show "Beyond the Fringe." Ifans (who's made a career out of playing memorable character roles in films such as Notting Hill and The Replacements) earned a BAFTA award for his performance.

link.synopsis: In a plot reminiscent of the 2001 Sigourney Weaver-Jennifer Love Hewitt comedy Heartbreakers, director Govind Menon profiles a two-woman con-artist team made up of the sexy Aunt Rukmini (Rekha) and her lovely niece, Padmini (Mallika Sherawat). Vowing to never fall in love with the men they set out to dupe, the pair gets into trouble when Padmini's romance with a young restaurateur (Karan Khanna) goes to her head.

link.synopsis: Two of the most popular segments of Comedy Central's "The Man Show" are paired on this gut-buster of a DVD. "The Man Show Boy" follows precocious teen Adam as he pulls a variety of Candid Camera-type gags on innocent victims (such as setting up a 25-cent beer stand). "Household Hints from Adult Film Stars" takes you into the homes of scantily clad porn starlets, who provide helpful tips such as how to fix the toilet and polish tarnished silver.

link.synopsis: When wanna-be screenwriter George Flynn (Jamie Kennedy) meets erstwhile teen star Kyle Carey (Loren Dean) at a Tinseltown bash, the scribe sees a chance to launch his career by befriending the actor. But cokehead Kyle's antics soon lead to trouble -- and a half-baked scheme to abduct Faye Dunaway's dog and hold the pooch for ransom. Clarence Williams III turns in a waggish performance as George's inept attorney in this satirical showbiz comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Jerry Springer: Undressed, Unleashed, Uncensored!: Vol. 2
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: Directed by Ilan Duran Cohen, this delightful French comedy chronicles the tempestuous relationship between Guilluame (Guillaume Quatravaux), a 24-year-old homosexual, and his doting but eccentric Jewish grandmother, Régine (Reine Ferrato). When a handsome new gay housekeeper (Jean-Philippe Sêt) enters the picture, however, Guilluame suddenly finds himself competing with the domestic for grandma's attention.
link.title: synopsis
First Love and Other Pains / One of Them

link.synopsis: Just as he's about to graduate, senior classman David Easter (Tim Carr) gets the shock of his young life when a new teacher invents 13th grade in this comedy. Their longed-for freedom threatened, David and his friends set out to make sure they graduate in the expected four years. Meanwhile, a Hollywood star (Dustin Diamond) who missed out on high school arrives on campus and develops a strange relationship with the school's 21-year-old principal.

link.synopsis: French model Nicole de Cortillon (Danielle Darrieux) takes on New York in this screwball comedy. Nicole tries to jump-start her modeling career with a nude assignment, but things go awry and she decides to focus her efforts on finding a rich husband. Convinced Nicole is a gold digger, handsome James Trevor (Douglas Fairbanks Jr.) tries to foil her plans but instead finds himself falling for the Parisian beauty. Louis Hayward co-stars.

link.synopsis: A Peeping Tom caretaker spies on his strange tenants in this comedy. Boardinghouse manager Jake (Jeffrey Quizon) drills specially positioned holes so he can sneak peeks at the lodgers, including sexy Cecila (Katya Santos) and her husband. Addicted to his voyeuristic habit, Jake becomes mesmerized by Cecilia's beauty, but his favorite pastime eventually results in an unfortunate accident. Gwen Garci and Allen Dizon co-star.

link.synopsis: Spooks abound in this supernatural comedy starring Vhong Navarro as skittish Hesus Resurreccion, a man whose ghost-ridden ancestral mansion harbors a portal to the otherworld. Every 100 years, the doorway must be opened so it can reveal the identity of "The One" -- the person designated to help usher spirits into the afterlife. Hilarity ensues as scaredy-cat Hesus finds out &NFi;he's&NFi_; the chosen one and literally crawls out of his skin with fear.

All About Love: Ang Sarap Ma-In Love

link.synopsis: Two desperate losers shake up their suburban community in this campy indie comedy. While preparing to enter the Miss Hope Springs Beauty Pageant, pathological prevaricator Destiny Rutt (Stephanie Orff) crosses paths with gay drifter Scott Bushey (Damion Dietz), who's just returned to his hometown. Tired of being flops, the improbable pair joins forces to ensure Destiny's victory in the pageant. Wil Wheaton turns up in a cameo role.

Surge of Power: The Stuff of Heroes
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Crazy Richard & I Can't Even Think Straight

link.synopsis: In this entertaining comedy, loquacious Lianne (Kris Aquino) and colorful Osmond (Eric Quizon) meet at a Gay Pride parade in the 1980s and begin a lifelong friendship. The inseparable chums help each other through life's toughest and most confusing situations -- especially when it comes to finding the right man. Though their relationship hits a few rough spots as the years pass, Lianne and Osmond remain best friends through good times and bad.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Charged with organizing his father's funeral, Wilson Chua (Eric Quizon) hires three professional mourners with plenty of problems and enough tears to flood Manila in this heartwarming comedy. Desperate for cash, Stella (Sharon Cuneta) is happy to take the weeklong gig crying at the traditional Chinese funeral, but the stage is set for disaster when she brings B-movie actress Chua (Hilda Koronel) and the adulterous Choleng (Angel Aquino) along.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Three young women search for Mr. Right in this romantic comedy from director Mac Alejandre. Single mother Raia (Ara Mina) wants an open-minded man who'll be a good father to her daughter. Meanwhile, gold-digger Samantha (Angel Locsin) pursues a rich teen, and Samantha's older sister, Susie (Aubrey Miles), has yet to learn that sexual favors may not be the best way to land a mate. Will these ladies ever find the path to happiness?
link.title: synopsis
Manila by Night: City After Dark
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote

link.synopsis: An economically depressed town in eastern Germany finds its collective fortune and libido rejuvenated upon the arrival of a superstar soccer player. With the championship game at hand, local beauty Sylvia (Johanna Klante) finds herself drawn to the celebrity athlete, while her boyfriend, Micha (Florian Lukas), indulges in a little infidelity himself. Tensions mount as the fickle lovers play the field, each hoping to score in this winning comedy.
link.title: synopsis
I Can No Longer Hear the Guitar
Heimat 3: A Chronicle of Beginnings and Endings
If I Want to Whistle, I Whistle

How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: In this comedy beset by a case of raging hormones, a British field hockey team made up of sex-obsessed teenage boys heads for Holland, where they find something far more interesting than tulips and windmills: namely, hot girls with lusty appetites. Soon, the boys' interest in the tournament takes a backseat to immersing themselves in the local color. A young Colin Firth stars in this bawdy romp from director Giles Foster.

The Rainbow / The Widowing of Mrs. Holroyd
When Did You Last See Your Father?

link.synopsis: Chaos ensues when a middle-school basketball team loses its coach in this family comedy starring Otis Robinson, Michael Washington and Nick Bert. With Coach Charles Monroe sidelined for medical reasons, the cagers look for a replacement, but no one makes the grade, so the squad decides to go "coachless." After on-court havoc and a string of losses put the season at risk, Monroe gets his doctor's permission to return -- but is it too late?

High School Phenoms: Top of the Class
Adolph Rupp: Myth, Legend and Fact

link.synopsis: While on tour in the West Bank, a small circus troupe from Eastern Europe finds that one of its featured attractions -- its lion -- is missing. The search for the beast draws together an unlikely alliance, but the united effort becomes more complicated as it continues. A wonderfully apt satire on the foibles of the human condition, this dark comedy collected five Israeli Film Academy Awards (including Best Film and Best Actor, Amos Lavie).

A Circus Season: Travels with Tarzan

link.synopsis: In this musical comedy about the American dream of finding a home, Barry's an eager-to-please real estate agent desperate to sell a house. Enter Debbie and Joel, two "sexy swipers" who spend their Sundays making love in open houses and then stealing trinkets. Mix in a down-on-his-luck jewel thief and a couple of adulterous cops trying to break a big case, and you've got a recipe for a madcap, toe-tapping treat. Dan Mirvish directs.

link.synopsis: After nobleman Don Salluste de Bazan (Louis de Funès) is banned from appearing in court, he and his assistant, Blaze (Yves Montand), are sentenced to collect taxes from the kingdom's poorest subjects. link.synopsis: Denise Filatrault's charming comedy, inspired by Michel Tremblay's novel, stars Ginette Reno as Laura Cadieux, a woman desperate to shed some excess weight. Her solution? To go to a famous doctor for a weekly injection that she hopes will melt away the fat. But she gains more than she loses when she's introduced to a community she so desperately needs, a group of other female patients who understand the roller-coaster she's on.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Writer-director Robert Lepage stars in this touching comedy about two brothers (both played by Lepage) who are polar opposites. Philippe is a Ph.D. who's broke and barely able to make ends meet, while Andre, a TV reporter, draws a handsome salary and leads a fabulous life. But the death of their mother prompts Philippe to rekindle his neglected relationship with his estranged sibling, though just how successful he'll be is anyone's guess.
link.title: synopsis
Never Take Candy from a Stranger / These Are the Damned

link.synopsis: Twin sisters Mitchee (Sara Gilbert) and Farrah (Molly Stanton) look and act nothing alike, a minor irony that's plagued them ever since they were born. But when their parents (Mark Linn-Baker of "Perfect Strangers" and Melanie Griffith) decide to entrust them with the family business, they'll have to put their differences aside to keep it afloat. The premiere season of this hilarious WB comedy will see if they succeed.

link.synopsis: This witty sex comedy stars Shirley MacLaine and James Coburn as a pair of married doctors who get caught up in tag-team mate swapping. After middle-aged Evelyn (MacLaine) begins a tryst with handsome younger man Greg (Stephen Collins), her workaholic hubby (Coburn) takes up with Greg's live-in lover, Stephanie (Susan Sarandon). But everything hits the proverbial fan when the two-timing couples end up vacationing at the same Acapulco resort.
link.title: synopsis
A Guide for the Married Man

link.synopsis: This enchanting comedy of unlikely friendships demonstrates that no matter how different we may seem, we all share common ground. Finding the orange grove that once belonged to his father transformed into a junkyard and occupied by Jewish Professor Bauman (Gideon Singer), Palestinian garbage man Phares (Salim Dau) sets up shop and refuses to leave, a stalemate that lasts until a Catholic nun (Laurence Bouvard) arrives to defuse the situation.

link.synopsis: The recipient of heaps of accolades at the Israeli Academy Awards, this gentle comedy  starring Aryeh Moskona and Daphna Rechner demonstrates that the popular fantasy of getting rich quick may not be as dreamy as it's cracked up to be. A nose-to-the-grindstone clan is given a chance to get their hands on the fortune they've always desired, but when they get their wish, they realize it's not the answer to their problems that they expected.
link.title: synopsis
Not Just the Best of the Larry Sanders Show
Turn Left at the End of the World

link.synopsis: Rounding up three decades' worth of hilarious performances from Iowa's innovative comedy troupe Duck's Breath Mystery Theatre, this 2004 show recorded in San Francisco resurrects all your favorite characters, including Randee of the Redwoods, Sister Mundi Mister Johnson, Ian Shoales and Mr. Tall Jars. Classic sketches include "Art Show," "Four Hole Buick (Car Opera)," "More Than a Box," "Outsourcing" and more.

link.synopsis: Chinese-American Ding Ding (Cherrie Ying) rocks a heartbroken boy's world in this romantic comedy. While attending drama school in Beijing, Ding Ding crosses paths with café owner Dong (Louis Koo), who's suffering selective memory loss after his girlfriend's demise, and Ding Ding -- a dead ringer for the woman -- is making matters worse. Can she help Dong find love again with help from his friend Dr. Chie (Tats Lau)?
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in China 2
Truth or Dare: 6th Floor Rear Flat
The Legend of the Flying Swordsman
Who's the Woman, Who's the Man
I Don't Want to Sleep Alone
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro

link.synopsis: Ze'ev Revach, Israel's most popular funnyman, takes on the dual roles of Victor and Michel in this campy comedy of errors. Identical twins Victor, a lowly custodian with seven children to feed, and Michel, an upscale, gay hair stylist, haven't seen each other for two decades. But when Victor pockets a pile of cash he stumbles across at work and then comes to regret it, he recruits his sibling to bail him out.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Well-heeled banker Kahana suspects his spouse of carrying on an affair with snaky Dr. Lux and enlists bumbling Detective Schwartz (played by Bomba Zur) to catch the coosome twosome in the act. Will the shifty doctor hoodwink the gumshoe and his ham-fisted assistant -- and steal Kahana's wife to boot? Suspicion, duplicity and gaucherie abound in this delightful 1973 comedy co-starring Yosef Shilohak, Uri Zohar and Talia Shapira.
link.title: synopsis
The Real Tomb Hunters: Snakes, Curses and Booby Traps

link.synopsis: The bohemian paradise that was Greenwich Village in the 1950s comes alive in this nostalgic comedy by Paul Mazursky. Lenny Baker stars as Larry Lapinsky, a wanna-be actor who leaves Brooklyn for the romance and excitement of downtown Manhattan, much to the chagrin of his controlling mother (Shelley Winters). Cutting the ties isn't as easy as he expected ... and neither is carving an identity in a neighborhood filled with eccentrics.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: It's Christmas in Cleveland, and as families gather round a feast of holiday treats and good cheer, Rana (Liz DuChez) and Mitch (Spencer Jay Kim) each find themselves alone. But what could be the worst day of their lives transforms into a magical adventure when they meet. That moment of serendipity will change them forever. Nick Mancuso and Danny Trejo co-star in this warm romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How to Go Out on a Date in Queens
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date

link.synopsis: As they seek romance and sexual gratification, the lives of eight Angelenos -- including a teenage trollop (Azura Skye), a wedding photographer (Tom Everett Scott) and a hotel desk clerk (Eion Bailey) -- converge on a carousel of carnal encounters. Elizabeth Banks and Anne Heche deliver memorable performances, as do screen veterans Shirley Knight and Fionnula Flanagan, in this insightful comedy of manners from director Ken Kwapis.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: Trying to add zing to his humdrum existence, middle-aged college professor Packard Schmidt (Julian Sands) instead puts himself on a path to disaster when he impetuously has an affair with his best friend's daughter (Katharine Towne) during a convention in Las Vegas. As Schmidt becomes increasingly obsessed with the girl, he finds his life going down the drain in this dark comedy also starring James Belushi as an Elvis-impersonating chauffeur.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Since he first burst onto the scene, Mexican-American comic Richard Villa has created quite a splash in the world of comedy, becoming a staple at the world-famous Improv on Melrose Avenue in Hollywood. In this side-splitting -- and fearless -- stand-up act, the gifted funnyman deftly explores the boundary between Mexican tradition and American culture, poking fun at his heritage and the lighter side of the immigrant experience.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This compilation of clips from two live performances captures musical surrealist Frank Zappa in 1974 and 1981, playing on the air for Los Angeles public television station KCET and in his element at his annual Halloween show in New York City. Musical tracks are interspersed with claymation and stop-motion animation (considered advanced effects at the time) as well as an assortment of comedy sketches.

link.synopsis: Promised a lucrative job, computer engineer Naveen (Raj Vasudeva) moves to New York and lands something far better than a swanky office in this romantic comedy. The new job is miserable, but Naveen perks up when he meets cutie Megha (Shweta Malhotra). The two hit it off, but Megha's Gujarati parents disapprove, friends interfere and the two struggle to keep their love alive despite bad advice, comic mishaps and misunderstandings.
link.title: synopsis
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come
P.D. James: Death in Holy Orders
American Experience: Minik: The Lost Eskimo

link.synopsis: After lying to his girlfriend, orthopedic surgeon Samir (Salman Khan) must conjure up a pretend wife in this musical comedy. The doctor keeps women at bay by telling them he's married, but he doesn't count on falling for model Sonia (Katrina Kaif), who refuses to accept her suitor's marriage proposal until she meets his phantom spouse. Chaos ensues when Samir coerces his loyal nurse (Sushmita Sen) to pose as his wife. Sohail Khan co-stars.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Wedding photographer Nick Evans (Joshua Beckett) surprises everyone -- including himself -- when he falls for a clothing designer in this romantic comedy. Womanizing Nick tries not to let his overbearing mother (Liz Sheridan) interfere with his swinging singles scene, but everything changes after he meets Anne Kidwell (Marcia Cross). Nick and Anne click instantly, and their bond soon grows … till Anne questions his ability to make a commitment.
link.title: synopsis
Harlequin Romance Series: At the Midnight Hour

link.synopsis: This quirky comedy from director Tatiana Bliss stars Liz Lavoie as Dana Lewis, the reigning queen of schlocky horror flicks. Fed up with the constant stream of shoddy scripts, she yearns for quality roles and is thrilled when she lands the lead in a new indie production. When the movie turns out to be an amateur slasher film produced by obsessed fan Jason Alves (Nipper Knapp), can Dana squeeze lemonade out of the lemon?
link.title: synopsis
The Private Life of a Masterpiece: Renaissance Masterpieces
A Shot at Love with Tila Tequila
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: A bartender serves up an overflowing pitcher of advice in this wry comedy starring Linden Ashby, Eddie Daniels, Richard Kind, Priscilla Barnes and Celeste Yarnall. When a Malibu couple hires balding barkeep Dennis (Kyle T. Heffner) for their soirée, they have no idea what they're in for. It seems that Dennis is also a psychology student … who decides to play impromptu analyst at the party despite his lack of credentials.
link.title: synopsis
Battle Girl: The Living Dead in Tokyo Bay
Killer at Large: Why Obesity is America's Greatest Threat

Dios los Junta y Ellos Se Separan

link.synopsis: Struggling actress Claudine Bloomberg (Justine Litchman) tries to find love in the big city in this romantic comedy. Heartbroken after being dumped by her model boyfriend, Hans (James Bowman), and then finding out he lied about returning home to Germany, Claudine sets her sights on Hans's nice-guy friend, Jack (Musashi Alexander). But complications arise when roommate Violet (Jordan Cael) tells Claudine she thinks Jack is gay.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands

link.synopsis: Korean director Young Man Kang's low-budget romantic comedy weaves a complicated love quadrangle without the restrictions of a script. While Toya (Toya Cho), a Korean-American model, only has eyes for Ken (Ken Yasuda), he couldn't be more blind to her advances. Meanwhile, Susan (Susan Petry), an actress, is madly in love with Gil (Everardo Gil), but he's been working so hard on a film documenting the true meaning of love that he doesn't notice.
link.title: synopsis
Assassination in Rome / Espionage in Tangiers

link.synopsis: This breezy gay romantic comedy stars Tony Yang as naive 17-year-old Tien, who heads to the big city for a summer of love and adventure. On his first night in Taipei, he locks eyes with an irresistible bad boy (Duncan Lai) said to be the planet's biggest playboy. Can the innocent Tien win over the licentious lothario and make him change his wanton ways? Chin King, Jimmy Yang and Dada Ji also star.
link.title: synopsis
Who's the Woman, Who's the Man
The Map of Sex and Love
